findings: The feature consistently activates at non-coding RNA elements across bacterial genomes. In section 1, strong activation occurs at tRNA-Tyr. In section 4, activation coincides with tRNA-Pro. conclusion: This feature reliably detects non-coding RNA structural elements across diverse bacterial genomes, particularly tRNAs and CRISPR repeats.
title: Non-coding RNA structural detector
description: This feature specifically detects structured non-coding RNA elements, primarily tRNAs and CRISPR repeats. It shows strong, localized activation directly at these elements, suggesting sensitivity to shared structural characteristics like stem-loops or other secondary structures common in these functional RNAs. The pattern is highly consistent across examples from diverse bacterial phyla (including Firmicutes, Proteobacteria, and Spirochaetes), indicating a fundamental recognition of RNA structural motifs that transcend taxonomic boundaries. The feature likely captures conserved sequence or structural signatures that are critical for the function of these non-coding RNAs in processes like translation and bacterial immunity.
